Other Information.Additional Info: Adsorption isotherm approaches linear type with moderate heat of adsorption (43 kJ mol−1). Dynamic C3H6 capacity is approximately 1.64 mmol g−1.
Propane breaks out immediately along with the inert gas He during breakthrough experiments, indicating sieving effect.

Sieving Mechanism: Size/shape sieving based on cross-section size of the contraction falling between propylene and propane sizes.

Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: C3H6/C3H8 selectivity: Not explicitly reported; Propylene diffusion coefficient: ~1.00 × 10−9 cm2 s−1 to 1.36 × 10−9 cm2 s−1; C3H6 productivity: 32.2 L kg−1 (99.9% purity)

Other Information.Additional Info: ZU-609 exhibits ultrafast adsorption kinetics for propylene separation with a measured diffusion coefficient one to two orders of magnitude higher than previous molecular sieves.
